CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 15, 1949, reads: "Republican Vote-Grabber - Despite the belief of the Pittsburgh Outdoor Advertising Company that a Republican campaign poster was 'gruesome' and in 'bad taste' and the practical concurrence of Judge Frank P. Patterson, the Republicans won their fight to place these posters on billboards throughout the city.  A sort of extra touch is given to this 'artist's conception' by placing in the possession of this sweet little white Evangeline a pop-eyed, black baby doll with bulging red lips.  Although the days of minstrelsy are far behind us, the insulting caricature will undoubtedly cause Mr. 'Tice' Ryan's adherents in the Negro community to wonder they're associating with the right people. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Republican campaign billboard with slogan "Make Our Homes and Streets Safe! Vote Republican" possibly on Morgan Street, Hill District
